## Plotting

For every question, there have to be the following plots:

-   Frequencies overall

-   Frequencies split over neutral/non-neutral

    <!--# Put all questions and labels into an external Excel file that can be used as the basis to plot from -->

```{r}

plot_question <- function(
    data = data, metadata = meta, question, wrap_width = 60) {
  
  meta_group <- metadata %>%
    filter(question_group == question) %>%
    arrange(order)
  
  # For multi-select questions that use multiple columns in the data:
  if (n_distinct(meta_group$question_code) > 1) { 
    data %>%
      pivot_longer(
        cols = all_of(meta_group$question_code),
        names_to = "question_code",
        values_to = "selected"
      ) %>%
      filter(selected == 1) %>%
      left_join(meta_group, by = "question_code") %>%
      ggplot(aes(x = fct_reorder(answer_label, order))) +
      geom_bar(fill = "steelblue") +
      coord_flip() +
      geom_text(stat = "count", aes(label = after_stat(count)),
                hjust = -0.1, size = 3) +
      scale_x_discrete(labels = ~ stringr::str_wrap(.x, width = wrap_width)) +
      labs(x = NULL, y = "Count") +
      theme_classic() #+
      # theme(
      #   axis.text.y = element_text(angle = 0, hjust = 1)
      # )
  
    } else {
    # Case 2: SINGLE-CHOICE (one column with coded values)
    qcol <- meta_group$question_code[1]

    data %>%
      filter(!is.na(.data[[qcol]])) %>%
      left_join(meta_group, by = join_by(!!.data[[qcol]] == value)) %>%
      ggplot(aes(x = fct_reorder(answer_label, order))) +
      geom_bar(fill = "steelblue") +
      coord_flip() +
      geom_text(stat = "count", aes(label = after_stat(count)),
                hjust = -0.1, size = 3) +
      scale_x_discrete(labels = ~ stringr::str_wrap(.x, width = wrap_width)) +
      labs(x = NULL, y = "Count") +
      theme_classic()
    
  }
}


plot_question(data, meta, "Q10b")
```
